intro: Pimelea amabilis, commonly known as the sweet pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces aromatic, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. Pimelea amabilis is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
